intro: Stipa hohenackeriana subsp. nachiczevanica, commonly known as the Armenian needlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical spikelets and fine, needle-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and ecological significance in its native range.
